paper_abstract: Published gas-to-Leonardite humic acid partition coefficient data, measured at a relative humidity of 98% and at 278.15, 288.15, 298.15, 308.15, and 318.15 K, were correlated with the Abraham solvation parameter model. The five derived temperature-specific correlations described the observed partition coefficient data to within an overall standard deviation of 0.33 log units. A method was devised for combining experimental partition coefficients measured at different temperatures into a single regression correlation. The proposed method described the 664 experimental partition coefficients, which covered the 278.15-348.15 K temperature interval, to within a standard deviation of 0.33 log units.
paper_title: Characterization of the partitioning of gaseous solutes into humic acid with the Abraham model and temperature-independent equation coefficients
